tag_professor: Get ready to read (2)  Participation matters (2)  Caring (1)  Inspirational (1)  BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES (1)
comments: Mark Elmore is one of the best professors at Davis. His style of teaching is very interactive, associative, and spontaneous, because he is trying to free up our minds and help us explore new ways of thought. Students should not expect to do well simply by studying and reading, but by allowing the class to actively engage with their lives.

tag_professor: Get ready to read (2)  Participation matters (2)  Caring (1)  Inspirational (1)  BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES (1)
comments: DO NOT TAKE HIS CLASS!!! In lectures, he rambles on and only gives you half of the picture and expects you to paint the rest. He tests you on the stuff he hasn\'t mentioned. Also, hands out study guides which is cool, but only 40% of the stuff that\'s on the study guides is on the test! He is confusing and the readings are L O N G and quizzes suck.

tag_professor: Get ready to read (2)  Participation matters (2)  Caring (1)  Inspirational (1)  BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES (1)
stu_tags: BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES  GET READY TO READ  PARTICIPATION MATTERS
comments: I just jumped in this class because I needed a GE but it was too much work for a simple GE. There are long 50 page readings due every class. The readings are dense, boring, and tedious. If you dont read though, you may fail a quiz. Way too much work and such a boring abstract subject that he does not do an excellent job in explaining. Great guy tho

tag_professor: Get ready to read (2)  Participation matters (2)  Caring (1)  Inspirational (1)  BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES (1)
comments: Thought it would be easy but he is actually really confusing and abstract. His lectures dont really help comprehension. Rambles, and called us out for not understanding. hw is easy tho. grades the 2 essays fairly if you research. Tests are harder for sure. I wouldnt rec this class if youre not interested in subject. You could prbly get A if you try

tag_professor: Get ready to read (2)  Participation matters (2)  Caring (1)  Inspirational (1)  BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES (1)
comments: Seems like a chill class at first but is actually A LOT of work. He is very bad at lecturing and getting his points across. He rambles on and on and in the end gets nowhere. Do not take this class if you\'re expecting an easy GE. He also has a bad temper and one lecture ended in him cussing us out and then storming out of the room. Do not take him

tag_professor: Get ready to read (2)  Participation matters (2)  Caring (1)  Inspirational (1)  BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES (1)
comments: He\'s too cute and funny! But he really knows the material and is extremely helpful and patient during OH. There are 2 essays, 1 midterm, and a final along with weekly assignments. Not a typical lecture. More like a big discussion. Material is interesting, but can get really hard. Just ask him, and no need to read all required readings!

tag_professor: Get ready to read (2)  Participation matters (2)  Caring (1)  Inspirational (1)  BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES (1)
comments: Best prof. that I\'ve taken at UCD! He is so nice and his class is super interesting. It is very difficult and you have to do the reading but it\'s totally worth it. I loved this class. I would recommend him to anyone. Again, it\'s not easy, but its totally worth it. You\'ll learn a ton! TAKE THIS CLASS! Prof Elmore is super cool and fun. My fav class!

tag_professor: Get ready to read (2)  Participation matters (2)  Caring (1)  Inspirational (1)  BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES (1)
comments: This course changed my life. You really have to think out of the box for this course. He is very passionate about religion. He challenged me to think in different ways. This is a demanding class. 3 Midterms no Final. Sections attendance is mandatory. Lectures are IMPORTANT. You need to read some readings because there are small quizzes.

tag_professor: Get ready to read (2)  Participation matters (2)  Caring (1)  Inspirational (1)  BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES (1)
comments: He is so passionate and the class isn\'t bad at all. Go to the lectures and pay close attention so you don\'t have to do the readings and it makes the tests/papers super easy. A 10 minute hw assignment every week. It\'s a really good class and you learn a lot! Definitely recommend taking this.

tag_professor: Get ready to read (2)  Participation matters (2)  Caring (1)  Inspirational (1)  BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES (1)
comments: You learn about three religions. Each religion has its own midterm. None of the midterms are cumulative and there is no final. The quizzes killed me. Even when you do the reading they are still confusing and difficult. The midterms weren\'t bad. With minor studying you can get a B. Study alot and you\'ll get an A. Class/section is basically mandatory

tag_professor: Get ready to read (2)  Participation matters (2)  Caring (1)  Inspirational (1)  BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES (1)
comments: You\'ll definitely need to think outside the box, but so long as you do that you won\'t have any issues. Elmore is extremely clear and helpful, and has a good sense of humor to top it off. You get pop quizzes in lecture that account for 15% of your grade, and discussion counts for 10%. Other than that, there\'s three exams total.

tag_professor: Get ready to read (2)  Participation matters (2)  Caring (1)  Inspirational (1)  BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES (1)
comments: Very good class to take if you are looking to learn more than just facts and see the deeper meaning of things. If you go to lecture and listen closely then the reading isn\'t necessary. 2 essays 3-4 pages each, 2 exams, and some short homework assignments so the workload isn\'t bad.

tag_professor: Get ready to read (2)  Participation matters (2)  Caring (1)  Inspirational (1)  BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES (1)
comments: The was among the most demanding religious studies classes I\'ve taken, yet the professor is very helpful. If you attend lecture regularly, do the readings, and study the key terms, you\'ll do great.

tag_professor: Get ready to read (2)  Participation matters (2)  Caring (1)  Inspirational (1)  BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES (1)
comments: Good teacher, gives pop quizzes, tests are not difficult. Pretty cool/approachable guy, spends a lot of time on ensuring students understand the concepts he\'s trying to teach. Go to class and pay attention, and you\'ll be fine. The reading isn\'t strictly mandatory, but it helps. Goes over modern biases we have, tries to bring awareness to students.

tag_professor: Get ready to read (2)  Participation matters (2)  Caring (1)  Inspirational (1)  BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES (1)
comments: He was a fair teacher. He\'s very down-to-earth and funny. Exams weren\'t bad at all. I\'d never had any experience with the subject matter, but he made everything clear in lecture. A word of advice if you\'re taking him: The reading is not always necessary, Got an A- in this class with no prior knowledge, & watch out for pop quizzes.

tag_professor: Get ready to read (2)  Participation matters (2)  Caring (1)  Inspirational (1)  BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES (1)
comments: Mark is an incredible teacher. He focuses on unraveling modern biases within students, so that concepts that may seem easy are completely deconstructed and rebuilt. And really knows how to pull this out of his students, rather than just preaching at them. He is very hard, but well worth it. He will teach you to think in a whole knew way.

tag_professor: Get ready to read (2)  Participation matters (2)  Caring (1)  Inspirational (1)  BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES (1)
comments: Only a 2nd quarter freshman so not much experience but he was by far my favorite of the quarter. Interesting lectures if a bit scattered. The kind of guy you\'d want to discuss with at length. DO THE READING. Concepts are difficult, and my TA helped me out a lot with them but I found myself talking to friends and family about what I learned.

tag_professor: Get ready to read (2)  Participation matters (2)  Caring (1)  Inspirational (1)  BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES (1)
comments: So far, one of my favorite classes and professors! He\'s really helpful if you have any questions and go to office hours. You can think about the concepts to the point that it actually hurts you\'re grade rather than helps it though. Overall though it is a very interesting and thought provoking class!

tag_professor: Get ready to read (2)  Participation matters (2)  Caring (1)  Inspirational (1)  BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES (1)
comments: Overall, not a bad class. Have to be willing to think outside the box. Really cares if his students understand the concepts presented. His powerpoints can be a bit confusing at times. In order to pass the class you must go to the lectures and discussion. Has a sense of humor.

tag_professor: Get ready to read (2)  Participation matters (2)  Caring (1)  Inspirational (1)  BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES (1)
comments: Don\'t be fooled by the name - the class focuses on defining religion, and then using those definitions to describe different religious practices. Lots of outside reading that you get quizzed on. Warning: only take this class if you are READY TO THINK, because it forces you to do that a lot. Going to lecture is necessary, and discussion helps a lot.
